Center: OECD/NEA Nuclear Data Bank, Boulogne-Billancourt, France
ref: Rept: Argonne National Laboratory report series, No.76-90, p.149 (1976)
title: -The U-238/U-235 Fission Cross Section Ratio Over The Energy Range 1.2 To 2 Mev -.

x4codes.hlp: Atomic Energy Research Establishment (AERE), Harwell, United Kingdom

x4codes.shortRef: Rept: Argonne National Laboratory report series, No.76-90, p.149 (1976)

x4freetext: PROCEEDINGS OF NEANDC
SPECIALISTS MEETING.
-THE U-238/U-235 FISSION CROSS SECTION RATIO OVER THE
ENERGY RANGE 1.2 TO 2 MEV -.
HARWELL SYNCHROCYCLOTRON.
PULSED NEUTRON BEAM FROM SYNCHROCYCLOTRON
TARGET, 140 MEV PROTONS, 4 MICRO-A, 800HZ, 10 NS PULSE
WIDTH. NEUTRONS TAKEN AT 180 DEGREES TO PROTON BEAM.
NO MODERATOR.
.ENRICHED FOILS OF U-238 AND U-235, DEPOSITED TO A
THICKNESS OF 0.5 MG CM-2 ON THIN AL BACKINGS OVER AN
AREA OF 7.6 CM DIAMETER.
TIME OF FLIGHT, 25 METER FLIGHT PATH, EVACUATED
OVER A DISTANCE OF 14 METERS.
GAS SCINTILLATION FISSION FRAGMENT DETECTOR,
THROUGH WHICH ARGON FLOWED CONTINOUSLY. THE FISSILE
FOILS WERE PLACES BACK TO BACK IN THE CENTRE OF
THE CHAMBER WHICH WAS OPTICALLY DIVIDED IN THE
PLANE OF THE FOILS, EACH HALF VIEWED THROUGH QUARTZ
WINDOWS BY TWO EMI 9816QKB PHOTOMULTIPLIERS.
FISSION FRAGMENTS.
GRAPH ONLY.
.NO CORRECTION WAS MADE FOR THE U-235 CONTENT OF THE
U-238 FOIL (0.036 PERCENT) OR FOR THE U-238 CONTENT
OF THE U-235 FOIL (6.06 PERCENT). IT WAS NOT POSSIBLE
TO MEASURE DIRECTLY THE BACKGROUNDS, HOWEVER AN
ENERGY DEPENDENT BACKGROUND GIVING A ZERO CROSS
SECTION FOR U-238 AT 0.2 AND 0.4 MEV WAS SUBTRACTED.
.THE PRINCIPAL OBJECTIVE WAS TO ESTABLISH AN ACCURATE
ENERGY FOR THE U-238 FISSION CROSS SECTION THRESHOLD.
THIS WAS DONE BY CAREFUL ASSESSMENT OF THE ENERGY
SCALE OF THE TIME OF FLIGHT SYSTEM, SEE AERE-7919.
THE MONITORED CARBON RESONANCE ENERGY WAS 2074+-3KEV.
BECAUSE OF UNCERTAINTIES ASSOCIATED WITH
BACKGROUND THE DATA ARE CONSIDERED BY THE AUTHORS
TO BE UNRELIABLE IN MAGNITUDE, AND WERE ONLY USED
AS A VERIFICATION OF THE DATA OF BEHRENS AND THE
REVISED DATA OF COATES.

x4headers.headerHelp: Lower limit of incident projectile energy range
Upper limit of incident projectile energy range
